templates.title: Plausible
templates.note: Deploys plausible analytics service, along with the database and supporting services

env.name: DISABLE_REGISTRATION
env.label: Disable registration
env.description: If true disables registrations. Registrations also won't work for invites

env.name: ADMIN_USER_EMAIL
env.label: Administrator email
env.description: The email you'll use to login as admin to plausible.

env.name: ADMIN_USER_NAME
env.label: Administrator username
env.description: The username you'll use to login as admin to plausible.

env.name: ADMIN_USER_PWD
env.label: Administrator password
env.description: The password you'll use to login as admin to plausible.

env.name: BASE_URL
env.label: Base URL
env.description: the URL for analytics - eg analytics.yourdomain.com

env.name: SECRET_KEY_BASE
env.label: secret_key_base
env.description: A key that will be used to encrypt sessions. Use a random string that is long enough, at least 64 chars

env.name: POSTGRES_DB
env.label: Database name
env.description: The database name in postgres database where to store data.

templates.title: Gitlab runner (Docker in docker)
templates.description: Gitlab runner instance to run your Gitlab CI pipelines
templates.note: If registration job fails, please restart it or run registration manually. PLEASE NOTE the security implications of running docker in docker!

env.name: GITLAB_RUNNER_IMAGE
env.label: Runner image
env.description: When changing this, please note Docker in docker restrictions

env.name: GITLAB_RUNNER_RUN_ONLY_PROTECTED
env.label: Run only protected
env.description: Runner only runs protected branches  For a protected runner, 'ref_protected' parameter. For an unprotected runner 'not_protected'

templates.title: Gitlab runner
templates.description: Gitlab runner instance to run your Gitlab CI pipelines
templates.note: If registration job fails, please restart it or run registration manually. WITHOUT docker in docker enabled

env.name: GITLAB_RUNNER_RUN_ONLY_PROTECTED
env.label: Run only protected
env.description: Runner only runs protected branches  For a protected runner, 'ref_protected' parameter. For an unprotected runner 'not_protected'

templates.title: Mastodon Instance
templates.description: Mastodon is a self hosted social media and micro blogging platform
templates.note: To generate Vapid Kyes run docker run -it tootsuite/mastodon bundle exec rake mastodon:webpush:generate_vapid_key. To generate individual secrets you can run docker run -it tootsuite/mastodon bundle exec rake secret

env.label: UNIQUE_INSTANCE_NAME
env.name: UNIQUE_INSTANCE_NAME
env.description: Unique instance name to enable multiple installations in same protainer. Do not use spaces or dots, and prefer -case

env.label: SECRET_KEY_BASE
env.name: SECRET_KEY_BASE
env.description: Secret key to encrypt sessions. Run 'docker run -it tootsuite/mastodon bundle exec rake secret' to generate

env.label: OTP_SECRET
env.name: OTP_SECRET
env.description: Secret key to encrypt one time tokens. Run 'docker run -it tootsuite/mastodon bundle exec rake secret' to generate

env.label: AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID
env.name: AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID
env.description: S3 static file storage Key ID
